description:
Driving bans

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
24311 Criminal prosecution statistics

Definition:
If a person has been convicted of a criminal offence, a
driving ban may be imposed for a period from one to three
months, if the offence was committed in connection with the
driving of a motor vehicle or in violation of the duties of
a driver of a motor vehicle. A driving ban shall typically
be imposed for specific traffic offences unless the driving
licence has been withdrawn.
